after.description: Limits on `time_created`, Marks the start of a range, optionally use `before` to set the end. Result output excludes the given timestamp.

after_id.description: Limits directly on `id`. Marks the start of a range, optionally use `before_id` to set the end. Result output excludes the given `id` value. Please note that `id` is in chronological order.

after_code.description: Limits directly on `code_hex`. Marks the start of a range, optionally use `before_code` to set the end. Result output excludes the given `code_hex` value.

before.description: Limits on `time_created`. Marks the end of a range, optionally use `after` to set the start. Result output excludes the given timestamp.

before_id.description: Limits directly on `id`. Marks the end of a range, optionally use `after_id` to set the start. Result output excludes the given `id` value. Please note that `id` is in chronological order.

before_code.description: Limits directly on `code_hex`. Marks the end of a range, optionally use `after_code` to set the start. Result output excludes the given `code_hex` value.

from.description: Limits on `time_created`. Marks the start of a range, optionally use `until` to set the end. Result output includes the given timestamp.

from_id.description: Limits on `id`. Marks the start of a range, optionally use `until_id` to set the end. Result output includes the given `id` value. Please note that `id` is in chronological order.

from_code.description: Limits on `code_hex`. Marks the start of a range, optionally use `until_code` to set the end. Result output includes the given `code_hex` value.

id_only.description: Removes `url` fields from output and shows `_id` instead of `_url` in references.

limit.description: Sets the maximum number of returned resources. You may increase this number to large values, keep in mind that query times could become large. We advise you to use the pagination feature whenever you can.

populate.description: Expand a reference into the actual resource (lookup). You may add multiple fields by giving a comma separated value.

results_only.description: Removes response envelope with information about query, only sends back a JSON array with the applicable resources.

select.description: Select which properties should be returned. You may add multiple fields by giving a comma separated value. Select can also be used together with populate: Specify the resource first, then a period(.) followed by the field.

sort.description: Allows you to sort on on or more fields in the resource. You may append a minus sign (`-`) to request reverse order (new to old).

until.description: Limits on `time_created`. Marks the end of a range, optionally use `from` to set the start. Result output includes the given timestamp.

until_id.description: Limits on `id`. Marks the end of a range, optionally use `from_id` to set the start. Result output includes the given `id` value. Please note that `id` is in chronological order.

timeout_s.description: Overrides the default query timeout (in seconds). A value of 0 means unlimited. IMPORTANT: using high timeouts in production code is strongly discouraged as it may lead to stability issues.

until_code.description: Limits on `code_hex`. Marks the end of a range, optionally use `from_code` to set the start. Result output includes the given `code_hex` value.

time_created.description: Filter on the time the resource was created.

time_updated.description: Filter on the time the resource was last updated

code_hex.description: Filter based on the hexadecimal string representation of the item. Supports wildcards: `*`.

is_present.description: Only show items which are present of not.

label.description: Filter based on the label value. Supports wildcards: `*`

metadata.description: Filter based on metadata. Does a partial match on any value in the metadata object. It is also possible to do an exact/wildcard match on specific properties, e.g. `metadata.foo=bar`

protocol.description: Filter based on the detected protocol of an item.

sets.description: Filter based on the set the resource is in.

technology.description: Filter based on the detected technology of an item.

text.description: Filter based on a full text search. Searched properties depend on the resource type. Matches on any of the given words. Supports quote (exact words) and minus (exclude) operators.

time_last_present.description: Filter based on the time last present

time_moved.description: Filter based on time last moved

type.description: Filter based on the type of an item.

$ul: **count**: The maximum number of items in the response (as set in the query or by default).
**count_current**: The maximum number of items available to return.
**is_limited**: Becomes false when the number of results is smaller than limit.
**next_url**: URL to the next page of items. ( null if none)
**query_duration_ms**: Amount of time, in milliseconds, the request needed to complete.
